Summary: Contract No. 2025Pa04198600: Provision of Integration and Professional Qualification Services Supporting Maintenance, Catering and Reception Services in Val Colleges. Description: The purpose of this contract is to provide integration and professional qualification services supported by maintenance, catering and reception services in Val d'Oise colleges. To this end, the Departmental Council of Val d'Oise entrusts the holder with the provision of support, professionalization and preparation for employment services for people far from employment, carried out in a productive framework integrating the economic, employment and organizational constraints of a classic business. The integration and professional qualification services are based on the following activities: - Maintenance of premises: Cleaning and routine maintenance of administrative premises, classrooms and circulation areas (in using the pre-impregnation method); - Maintenance of mineral surfaces and green spaces; - Catering: Service activities related to meals, cleaning and disinfection of premises, and collective catering equipment (including dishes); - Reception: Reception activities in colleges. To support their application, candidates must provide the structural agreement with the DRETTS (Regional Directorate of the Economy, Employment, Labor and Solidarity). The market is launched according to one of an adapted procedure opened in application of articles R2123-1 3°, R. 2123-4 to -7, R. 2162-1 to -6, R.2162-13 to -14 of the Public Procurement Code. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: DEPARTMENTAL COUNCIL OF YVELINES. Summary: Provision of Simulations and Comparative Financial and Tax Analyzes of Local Authorities and the Department of Yvelines. Description: The contract covers the provision of simulations and comparative financial and tax analyzes for local authorities (French departments, municipalities, EPCI, etc.) and the Department of Yvelines. The possible recipients of the requested studies are the President of the departmental council, the Director General of Services and the Directorate of Finance and Evaluation. The simulation and analysis services requested must make it possible to: · assess the consequences of legislative developments or of local choices on the financial and fiscal situation of the community (taxation, DGF, equalization, tax potential, etc.), · to compare the situation of the community from a financial and fiscal point of view compared to other departments (for example strata, geographical grouping, etc.) by highlighting the strong points or weaknesses and explaining the causes. The form of the contract is single-award, that is to say it will be concluded with a single economic operator. The market is a framework service agreement, with purchase orders, without minimum and with a maximum amount per period of 70,000 euro(s) excluding tax. Published Date: 2025-12-27. Closing Date: 2026-02-02. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Provision of Simulations and Comparative Financial and Tax Analyzes of Local Authorities and the Department of Yvelines

The simulation and analysis services requested must make it possible to: · assess the consequences of legislative developments or of local choices on the financial and fiscal situation of the community (taxation, DGF, equalization, tax potential, etc.), · to compare the situation of the community from a financial and fiscal point of view compared to other departments (for example strata, geographical grouping, etc.) by highlighting the strong points or weaknesses and explaining the causes. The form of the contract is single-award, that is to say it will be concluded with a single economic operator. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: METPARK. Summary: Maintenance of Fire Doors and Curtains, Dampers. Description: This consultation follows a declaration without follow-up and aims to carry out preventive and curative maintenance services for fire doors and curtains and flaps in car parks operated by METPARK. THE technical specifications and terms of execution of the services are detailed in the Specifications of Special Technical Clauses (CCTP). This contract is a composite framework agreement with an ordinary market part concluded at a fixed price and part of a framework agreement with purchase orders concluded at a unit price. An on-site visit is mandatory. Following the visit, a visit certificate will be issued by METPARK. The visiting conditions are as follows: The visit to the sites is collective and takes place over 1 day, on one of the following two dates: - January 5, 2026 at 9:30 a.m. - January 6, 2026 at 9:30 a.m. The meeting place is: Parking Gambetta Rue Edmond Michelet, 33000 Bordeaux The car parks visited will be: Mériadeck, Victoire, Pey Berland, Saint Jean and Gambetta. Candidates must present themselves at the place, day and time of visit fixed above and stay for the duration of the visit. In order to set the terms of visit, candidates are invited to take previously contact METPARK, via the AWS platform via the “correspondence” tab, at the following address: https://www.marches-publics.info/. Summary: 25Vc0212Aoo - Financial and Organizational Control Mission of Subsidized Organizations, Beneficiaries of Loan Guarantees and other Organizations and One-Off Audit Missions. Description: The services covered by this contract consist of carrying out expertise, control, financial and organizational audit missions for satellite organizations of Toulouse Town Hall and Toulouse Métropole. Audit requests may concern different types of organizations (Mixed Economy Company, association, social landlord, etc.). The audit will be commissioned by the community or public establishment which pays a subsidy, which holds a participation or which guarantees the loan of a body. A specific financial analysis mission may be requested without the organizational analysis. The missions of this contract will cover the financial years 2025 to 2028. It is subject to the provisions of articles L. 2124-2, R. 2124-2 1° and R. 2161-2 to R. 2161-5 of the Public Procurement Code. The framework agreement with maximum is entered into in application of articles L2125-1 1°, R. 2162-1 to R. 2162-6, R. 2162-13 and R. 2162-14 of the Public Procurement Code. The framework agreement will be executed by issuing purchase orders. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: OPH 13 LIVES. Summary: Outsourced On-Call Service for Handling Technical Emergencies on 13 Habitat Heritage Outside Working Hours. Description: 13 Habitat processes 150,000 requests per year, or an average of 12,500 requests per month of all types (technical/administrative/incivility). 55% of these requests are of a technical nature. A single service provider provides reception telephone call for tenants of 13 Habitat: -The customer relations center is open from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. continuously from Monday to Friday, -A telephone on-call service ensures continuity during nights, weekends and public holidays for support of technical emergencies only. He is responsible for qualifying the request and establishing a remote diagnosis wherever possible to characterize the emergency. Administrative requests and non-urgent technical requests are redirected to the day shift for deferred treatment. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: EDF SA. Summary: Framework Contract for the Maintenance of Source Substations and Mv/Lv Substations for Edf Martinique. Description: Framework agreement for a period of 6 years relating to the maintenance of green spaces (weeding, clearing) of buildings, and small works at Source Substations and MV/LV substations on the territory of Martinique, on behalf of EDF SEI MARTINIQUE. The market is allocated (1 lot for source substations, 1 lot for MV/LV substations) Lot 1: Maintenance of MV/LV substations for EDF SEI Martinique This lot includes the maintenance and cleaning of the various HTA/LV distribution stations of EDF MARTINIQUE, and includes switching cabinets (for example AC3M, AC3T, HTA/BT etc). Services include cleaning of premises, and maintenance of access to stations by weeding and clearing (maintenance of green spaces) Lot 2: Maintenance of Posts Source for EDF SEI Martinique This lot includes the maintenance and cleaning of the various Source stations of EDF MARTINIQUE. Services include: Cleaning of premises, Maintenance of green spaces by weeding or manual uprooting, brush clearing and tree pruning, and finally fence maintenance. Other projects will be scheduled in the coming months. come through the events department and the cultural department (summer festivities, end-of-year celebrations, Halloween, etc.). They will be the subject of other consultation notices. The estimated annual value of these events (events and culture combined) being close to the level of the European thresholds, these consultations will need to be published in the OJEU. (Official Journal of the European Union). The municipal services, to establish the artistic programming of the various events of the year, assist regularly to shows that they may be required to pre-select or select. They also directly receive proposals which they can present to the selection committee composed of the Director of the Mayor's Office, the Deputy Mayor. Events, the Deputy for Culture and the Director of Culture and Events. Likewise, the City can call on local associations to enrich its programming. This call for projects aims to enable it to broaden its choice, to increase its knowledge of the local, national and even European cultural environment, to offer the best shows, to complete and finalize its annual programming. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: MARTINIQUAIS TOURISM COMMITTEE. Summary: Agriculture Show 2026. Description: As part of its missions to promote the destination and support impactful projects, the CMT, in support of the Chamber of Agriculture of Martinique, two satellite structures of the Territorial Collectivity of Martinique, will represent the Martinican territory during the 62nd edition of the show. In hall 7.2, “Products from Metropolitan France and Overseas”, the Martinique Tourism Committee will have a space accompanied by its partners. This 2026 edition of the SIA will highlight Martinican agriculture through the cow "Biguine" which will be the face of the 2026 edition during the 9 days of the agricultural show. This cow belongs to the Brahman breed, descended from the Indian zebu, white in color, with a silvery gray reflection. For meet the regulatory requirements linked to public procurement, the CMT plans the launch of 5 distinct batches:. Published Date: 2025-12-25. Closing Date: 2026-01-28. Competition: ICB. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CAMPUS OF EXCELLENCE INDUSTRY OF THE FUTURE - SOUTH. Summary: Providing Support for the Administrative and Financial Management of the Association.. Description: The Campus d'Excellence Industrie du futur - Sud association wishes to entrust the provision of its financial and administrative management to an external service provider. The objective of the mission is to carry out all financial management tasks and administrative requirements necessary for the proper functioning of the association: • Operational support for management on administrative and financial matters; • Establishment and monitoring of the overall forecast budget; • Support for annual financial closing ; • Support for the preparation of the association's annual qualitative assessment; • Monitoring of financing agreements and deadlines; • Continuous improvement of management processes and associated tools; • Reporting to management; • Participation in bodies such as General Assemblies, Boards of Directors and Executive Office (preparation of materials, face-to-face participation, presentation of financial subjects); • Routine administrative monitoring (management of supplier invoices, verification expense reports, etc.); • Support for the financial arrangement of complex projects; • Contracting of suppliers; • Coaching on competition rules; • Reporting to governance bodies; • Administrative management of skills sponsorships (agreements, tax receipts, etc.); • Cash flow monitoring; • Preparation and publication of public contracts; • Advice on management rules, funding eligibility and regulations.... input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: COMMUNITY OF MIRAMAS. Summary: Social and Professional Integration Benefits Supporting Various Activities. Description: By virtue of article L. 2113-13 of the Public Procurement Code, the lots, subject of the consultation, are reserved for integration structures through economic activity mentioned in article L. 5132-4 of the labor code and for equivalent structures, when they employ a minimum proportion, fixed by regulation, of disadvantaged workers. The framework agreement with the maximum specified in the CCAP is entered into in application of articles L2123-1 3° and R.2123-1 3°, L2125-1 1°, R. 2162-1 to R. 2162-6, R. 2162-13 and R. 2162-14 of the Public Procurement Code. It will result in the issuance of purchase orders. Framework agreement with purchase order concluded for a period of 1 year from the date of notification of the contract. The framework agreement may be renewed 3 times per period of one year for a total duration of the contract not exceeding 4 years according to the conditions provided for in the CCAP. The framework agreement is broken down into 6 lots. Published Date: 2025-12-25. Closing Date: 2026-01-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: Surveillance, Safety and Aquatic Rescue of Human Bodies of Water. the Contract is Concluded for a Period Ranging from its Notification to December 31, 2026, Knowing That. Description: The site is a leisure area belonging to the departmental public domain of Indre-et-Loire. Located near the village of Hommes, it is a natural and leisure area made up of bodies of water, wooded areas and facilities intended for reception of the public. The site welcomes a large audience each year, particularly during the summer period, attracted by swimming, the nautical base, the play and picnic areas or even fishing and hiking. Former faluns extraction quarry, surface area of 31 hectares including 20 ha of water spread over 6 basins, classified among the E.N.S. of Indre-et-Loire. Open to the public free of charge, this site is subject to significant family attendance during the day during the summer season.. Published Date: 2025-12-25. Closing Date: 2026-01-16. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY. Summary: Maintenance of the National Assembly-S Power Plant. Description: The purpose of the framework agreement is the preventive, corrective and improvement maintenance of the 4 generators of the National Assembly distributed as follows: • 3 generators called the power plant located at the Palais Bourbon. These power plants supply all safety installations within the meaning of the fire safety regulations in ERPs. They are also used as a full replacement source for several buildings; • 1 safety generator located at 33 rue Saint-Dominique (called Las Cases). This group supplies the security installations of this building within the meaning of the fire safety regulations in establishments open to the public (ERP). This market imposes on the holder a requirement of maximum availability and performance obligations for preventive maintenance services (annual breakdown rate not to be exceeded), for corrective maintenance services (intervention, troubleshooting and repair deadlines to be respected) and for improvement maintenance (new equipment under warranty). Corrective maintenance operations must be carried out 24/7. The provisions of the specific technical clauses (CCTP) describe the terms of execution of the services.. Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-02-05. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: ANGERS LOIRE METROPOLE (49). Summary: Catering Services. Description: The purpose of this contract is to provide catering services. It was awarded following the open call for tenders procedure and is broken down into five lots. Its duration is set at four years, divided into two execution periods of two years. Aperitif cocktails, lunch or dinner and coffee breaks The lot concerns mainly standing catering services, intended for institutional events (inaugurations, meetings, receptions). The services are available in three ranges (Standard, Intermediate and Premium) including coffee breaks, drinks receptions and cocktails, distinguished by the level of quality of the products, the diversity of the offer, the presentation and the associated services. The holder ensures the communication of information relating to allergens before the service and on site. Meal trays and sandwich basket This lot concerns the provision of individual meals without on-site service, intended for meetings and business trips. He includes meal trays constituting complete ready-to-eat meals, incorporating a vegetarian alternative, the necessary crockery and, on request, drinks, as well as sandwich baskets adapted to fast food needs, including a sandwich, a dessert and, if applicable, a drink. Breakfasts and snacks This lot covers catering services that are simple and quick to implement, mainly intended for international meetings.... Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-01-30. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: THE POST OFFICE. Summary: Customs Clearance Service on all Goods Coming from Countries Outside the European Union and Imported into the Overseas Departments and Regions (Drom) for the Services-Mail Branch.... Description: Customs clearance service on all goods coming from countries outside the European Union and imported into the Overseas Departments and Regions (DROM) for the Services-Mail Branch... La Poste wishes to entrust an expert company with customs clearance and declaration operations with the General Directorate of Customs and Indirect Duties (DGDDI) on its behalf on all goods coming from countries outside the European Union and imported into the overseas territories. The perimeter of customs clearance operations are as follows: • All objects, Parcels and Small Import Packages (PPI known as E-PAQ) destined for mainland France and coming from third countries (non-EU) whose value is strictly greater than €150 to make a declaration complete H1 •All objects, Parcels and PPI destined for mainland France and coming from third countries (non-EU) whose value is less than €150 and for which an H7 declaration is to be made from automated customs clearance or in manual when automation has not been possible. • All Parcels from France to DOM and PPI third countries to DOM, to make a simplified declaration called H7+ for values ​​less than or equal to €150 and H1 for values ​​strictly higher at 150€. • Carrying out invalidations of declarations in the event of return of the product (Parcel and PPI). The market consists of a single lot intended for one successful bidder. The processing of La Poste data, including hosting, backup and/or consultation must be located within the European Union (EU), a country in the European Economic Area (EEA), a country recognized as suitable.... input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PUBLIC COMPANY OF MARSEILLE SCHOOLS. Summary: Overall Performance Contract for the Rehabilitation and Construction Operation of the Les Prairies School Group - 13013 Marseille - Applications Phase. Description: This consultation follows the publication of a previous contract which the contracting authority declared without action, in accordance with articles R. 2185-1 and R. 2385-1 of the public procurement code, due to a redefinition of the need. There initial consultation bore the number 2025-0052 and was the subject of declaration letters without action dated 03/12/2025. This procedure is carried out autonomously and independently of the initial consultation. Considering the objectives of performance of the project management on this operation, the Company has opted for the award of a global performance contract in accordance with the provisions of article L. 2173-3 of the Public Procurement Code. The choice of such a mode of devolution leads the non-division of the market and, de facto, the use of a single market. This global public performance contract includes services of: - Design and execution of rehabilitation, extension, construction and development works exteriors and temporary buildings where applicable. - Operation and maintenance of the equipment, including those allowing monitoring and compliance with performance. It concerns the rehabilitation and construction operation of the Les school group PRAIRIES, 35 chemin de Saint-Mître in Four de Buze- 13013 Marseille. In this context, a consultation is launched in order to respond to the following strategic issues: -Secure voice flows; -Control sessions (routing, call policies, bandwidth management); -Interoperability between equipment from different brands or protocols (Mitel, Avaya, Teams, SIP Trunk SFR); -Ensure quality of service (deadlines, prioritization of flows). input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: ETAMPES TOWN HALL. Summary: Maintenance of the Grass Football Field at Stade Jean Laloyeau. Description: The town of Etampes has a field of honor allowing it to host football matches and sporting events. This equipment (Terrain D'Honneur) was put into service in 1992, this sports area has a natural grass floor and a capacity in the stands and promenade of 575 people, plus 78 people for staff and players. The development area is 7140 m². The subject of the consultation concerns maintenance throughout the year including curative maintenance (rehabilitation condition of the pitch before each match of the season, filling of holes, mowing and striping) and preventive maintenance (work to be carried out in spring (use of fertilizers, weedkillers), in summer (use of fertilizers, dethatching, supply of sand, aeration and refilling) and in the fall (application of fertilizer and decompaction of the land). Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-01-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CAMPUS OF EXCELLENCE INDUSTRY OF THE FUTURE - SOUTH. Summary: Providing Support for the Administrative and Financial Management of the Association.. Description: The Campus d'Excellence Industrie du futur - Sud association wishes to entrust the provision of its financial and administrative management to an external service provider. The objective of the mission is to carry out all financial management tasks and administrative necessary for the proper functioning of the association: • Operational support for management on administrative and financial matters; • Establishment and monitoring of the overall forecast budget; • Support for annual financial closing ; • Support for the preparation of the association's annual qualitative assessment; • Monitoring of financing agreements and deadlines; • Continuous improvement of management processes and associated tools; • Reporting to management; • Participation in bodies such as General Assemblies, Boards of Directors and Executive Office (preparation of materials, face-to-face participation, presentation of financial subjects); • Routine administrative monitoring (management of supplier invoices, verification expense reports, etc.); • Support for the financial arrangement of complex projects; • Contracting of suppliers; • Coaching on competition rules; • Reporting to governance bodies; • Administrative management of skills sponsorships (agreements, tax receipts, etc.); • Cash flow monitoring; • Preparation and publication of public contracts; • Advice on management rules, funding eligibility and regulations.... Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-01-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: AGRIPARIS ITS. Summary: Composite Framework Agreement, Relating to the Monitoring and Evaluation of the “Seine Nourricière” Territorial Demonstrator and the Actions of the Agriparis Seine Association.. Description: This contract concerns a single-award composite framework agreement to support the AgriParis Seine association in its mission as an observatory of sustainable agri-food sectors. Particularly for the monitoring, evaluation and replicability of actions implemented in the “Seine Nourricière” territorial demonstrator. This winning action program from the Banque des Territoires aims to strengthen the sustainability of local food systems, to structure agricultural sectors and to promote replicability of actions in other territories. This framework agreement aims to provide the beneficiary with contractual support allowing them to access intellectual services of project management assistance and project management for the carrying out studies and leading consultation meetings.. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: DEPARTMENTAL COUNCIL OF GIRONDE. Summary: Annual Maintenance 2026 of the Ship Sébastien Vauban. Description: This framework agreement corresponds to a recurring need because each year the ship SEBASTIEN VAUBAN, managed by the Departmental Maritime Transport Department, must be subject to maintenance. This technical stop is broken down into 3 parts which correspond to 3 maintenance lots: Lot 1 boilermaking, lot 2 mechanics, lot 3 painting. Each lot will be the subject of a separate framework agreement. Companies will be able to make proposals for one or more lots and will have to respond to the lot(s) of their choice in its (their) entirety. The delivery time for the service will be specified in each order form. The services will take place from 03/09/2026 to 03/27/2026. A drying period of 10 working days, entry and exit from the dry dock, will be integrated into this period. The place of execution of the work will be at the Grand Maritime Port of Bordeaux, Bassin à flot à Bacalan, form 1. A visit is planned for the 3 lots on December 1, 2025 at 8:30 a.m. in Blaye. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2025-12-31. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: RATP. Summary: General Overhaul of Maximum 70 Escalators of the Otis 513 Npe Brand (Lot Market). Description: This notice concerns the general overhaul of maximum 70 escalators (EM) of the OTIS 513 NPE subfamily over a maximum period of 36 months. The services to be carried out are divided between basic services (PB) to be carried out systematically on each EM and additional services (PC) to be carried out depending on the condition of the equipment and on request from RATP. The consultation is allocated as follows: Lot 1- Minimum 13 escalators (PB)/ Maximum 19 escalators (PB+PC) Lot 2 - Minimum 12 escalators (PB) / Maximum 17 escalators (PB+PC) Lot 3 - Minimum 13 escalators (PB) / Maximum 18 escalators (PB+PC) Lot 4 - Minimum 11 escalators (PB) / Maximum 16 escalators (PB+PC) Candidates can respond to all lots but can only be awarded two lots. The work carried out must meet the standards in force (regulatory, normative and safety requirements, escalator standards, order for ERPs, etc.). The objective is to treat the mechanical wear of certain parts, and to reduce the number of breakdowns of this equipment. The general overhaul includes the following basic and/or additional services (non-exhaustive list): •The supply and the replacement of the departure and arrival combs; •Replacement of the walking chain + oiling; •Overhaul of all the brakes (linings, FF and FA coils) •Draining the.... Description: The HDH is looking for a service provider to support it in the organization and production of virtual or physical, or hybrid events. Through its legal missions to decompartmentalize health data assets, improve its quality and guarantee the participation of civil society in the use of health data, the Health Data Hub wishes to organize events (conferences, symposia, webinars). To illustrate and make understandable to as many people as possible its role, its missions and its interactions with its partners, the HDH has put in place an events strategy, made up of national and international events, free or paid, open to very broad audiences, researchers, academics, students, start-ups, institutional, general public, press, industrial taking various forms such as national/international conferences, webinars, etc. The HDH is looking for a structure that supports it in the organization and execution of existing events and more to come Support in the organization and production of virtual or physical, or hybrid events The HDH is looking for a service provider to support it in the organization and production of virtual or physical, or hybrid events. Description: Energy Storage - Call for Applications for the Supply of Lithium Iron Phosphate (Lfp) Batteries And, if Applicable, the Inverter, Transformer, and Operation and Maintenance (O&M) for the Dc or Dc+Ac P... <br> Energy storage - Call for applications for the supply of Lithium Iron Phosphate (LFP) batteries and, if applicable, the inverter, transformer, and operation and maintenance (O&M) for the DC or DC+AC part of an energy storage project in France (Variscourt). <br> EDF Power Solutions, a leader in renewable energy production and a subsidiary of the EDF group, carries the group's ambitions in renewable energies. The market concerns the installation of batteries and the potential operation and maintenance of a storage project in Variscourt (Hauts-de-France region). The storage facility has the following characteristics: - Battery capacity: 95 MWh - Battery power: 47.5 MW - Technology: LFP (lithium iron phosphate) - Project duration: 25 years - COD: Q1/2028 Execution part: The contractor must provide and install the lithium iron phosphate batteries and, if applicable, the inverter and transformer that meet the technical specifications and safety standards of EDF Power Solutions. Operation - Maintenance part: The operation and maintenance of the site will be based on a contract with a maximum duration of 25 years. The contractor must take into account all the technical characteristics of the project related to the execution phase. During the duration of this contract, the contractor will receive an annual fixed remuneration based on its pricing offer which will include: - Site supervision and security - Preventive maintenance of DC or AC equipment - Corrective maintenance of DC or AC .... input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: EDF POWER SOLUTIONS. Summary: Variscourt Epc Bess Consultation (Engineering, Equipment Procurement, Construction, Commissioning and O&M). He will have to respond to the scope of work which will include the total or partial preparation of the site, the supply and installation of control equipment and, where applicable, DC during the implementation phase, while ensuring management of the chain supply, their installation on site and their connection. The EPC must meet the O&M scope. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SAINTE GENEVIÈVE DES BOIS TOWN HALL. Summary: Public Service Concession Relating to the Construction, Operation and Financing of a Crematorium in Sainte-Genevieve-Des-Bois. Description: Aware of the evolution of practices in the funeral field, the increase in the use of cremation in the years to come, and in order to improve its offer of funeral services, the Municipality of Sainte-Geneviève des Bois has considered the construction of a crematorium on its territory. A feasibility study, carried out in August 2025, confirmed the opportunity to build a crematorium on the territory of the Community due to the existing potential in terms of attendance, but also to allow to reduce cremation times in the north of the Essonne department. Given the specific nature of the management of such equipment, the use of a delegated management method such as public service delegation in the form of a service concession appeared to be the most relevant contractual arrangement for the realization of this project.. Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-03-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: SAINTE GENEVIÈVE DES BOIS TOWN HALL
output.Summary: Public Service Concession Relating to the Construction, Operation and Financing of a Crematorium in Sainte-Genevieve-Des-Bois
output.Description: Aware of the evolution of practices in the funeral field, the increase in the use of cremation in the years to come, and in order to improve its offer of funeral services, the Municipality of Sainte-Geneviève des Bois has considered the construction of a crematorium on its territory. A feasibility study, carried out in August 2025, confirmed the opportunity to build a crematorium on the territory of the Community due to the existing potential in terms of attendance, but also to allow to reduce cremation times in the north of the Essonne department. Given the specific nature of the management of such equipment, the use of a delegated management method such as public service delegation in the form of a service concession appeared to be the most relevant contractual arrangement for the realization of this project.

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CITY OF BESANCON. Summary: Framework Agreement for Professional Integration for the Maintenance of Public Spaces. Description: The purpose of this framework agreement is the social and professional integration of residents of Greater Besançon who are permanently excluded from the labor market or who encounter difficulties in accessing or maintaining employment. The community will entrust to the holder retained support services and employment support within the framework of socially useful activities mainly focused on the maintenance of public spaces and schoolyards in social housing neighborhoods. These paid working hours, support of the integration process, will necessarily be accompanied by a support system specific to each person. The services are to be carried out: - in the commune of Besançon, mainly in social housing districts: neighborhoods of Planoise, Clairs-Soleils/Bregille, Palente/Orchamps and "408" Cité Brûlard, Montrapon, StClaude, Zone de Témis, Malcombe, Rosemont - on the territory of GBM, mainly in the ZAEd-Ecole-Valentin, de Franois, BTC, Marnières and on some cycle paths (see CCTP for all services). input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PINTADE INTERPROFESSIONAL COMMITTEE. Summary: Design and Implementation of a Collective Communication Campaign in Favor of Guinea Fowl in France, Belgium, Germany and the Netherlands.. Description: With this call for tenders, the CIP is seeking to identify a service provider (or a group of service providers) capable of supporting it throughout its guinea fowl promotion strategy. This support ranges from the implementation of the main axes of the campaign strategy to the measurement of its performance through its complete operational execution. The selected communications agency must have the know-how and experience necessary to support the CIP on all channels of its communication as well as in the conduct of action programs benefiting from European co-financing. This call for tenders covers a period of three years which is not tacitly renewable. The completion of the action is conditional on the selection by the European Commission of the proposal (simple program) which will be submitted by the CIP as part of the 2026 call for proposals under EU Regulation 1144/2014.. Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: GUINEA FOWL INTERPROFESSIONAL COMMITTEE. Summary: Collective Information and Promotion Campaign for Guinea Fowl in France, Belgium, Germany and the Netherlands. Description: With this call for tenders, the CIP seeks to identify a service provider (or a group of service providers) capable of supporting it throughout its strategy to promote guinea fowl. This support ranges from the implementation of the main axes of the campaign strategy to the measurement of its performance through its complete operational execution. The selected communications agency must have the know-how and experience necessary to support the CIP on all channels of its communication as well as in the conduct of action programs benefiting from European co-financing. This call for tenders covers a period of three years which is not tacitly renewable. The completion of the action is conditional on the selection by the European Commission of the proposal (simple program) which will be submitted by the CIP as part of the 2026 call for proposals under EU Regulation 1144/2014. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PAYS DE LA LOIRE REGION. Summary: Animation and Implementation of the Docob for the Natura 2000 Limestone Plain Site in Southern Vendée from April 1, 2026 to March 31, 2028. Description: Animation and implementation of the DOCOB for the Natura 2000 Limestone Plain site in southern Vendée from April 1, 2026 to March 31, 2028 General presentation The Natura 2000 sites “Limestone plain of the south Vendée” (ZPS n° FR5212011) is located in the south-east of the department of Vendée. This site is part of the limestone plain of southern Vendée which forms a corridor of open landscapes of nearly 60,000 ha extending from west to east between the clayey lands of the Vendée bocage and the bri of the Marais Poitevin marsh. The perimeter extends over 6,701 ha and concerns 11 municipalities. It is located in the southern part of the Plain, on the edge of the marsh between Luçon and Fontenay le Comte. Challenges of the site The plain areas are of great interest for the preservation of fragile species. They welcome in fact, birds characteristic of open cultivated environments, some of which are very vulnerable at the European and French level, such as the Little Bustard, the Greater Oedicnema, the Eurasian Harrier, the Gray Partridge, the Corn Quail, the Skylark, the Golden Plover, the Northern Lapwing… These species are present on the southern Vendée plain (apart from the Little Bustard which has disappeared since the site was designated as an SPA), particularly between Luçon and Fontenay. Today, the main Threats to species are similar to intensive agricultural practices. Several Agro-Environmental and Climate Measures (MAEC) have been put in place since 2013 in order to financially support.... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-02-13. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PAYS DE LA LOIRE REGION. Summary: Framework Agreement for Project Management Assistance for the Preparation, Award and Monitoring of Operations-Performance Maintenance and Associated Services Contracts (Mempsa) for the Needs of Eps.... Description: Framework agreement for project management assistance for the preparation, award and monitoring of Operations-Performance Maintenance and Associated Services Contracts (MEMPSA) for the needs of EPs... The Pays de la Loire Region wishes to register fully in achieving the objectives of the Tertiary Eco Energy System (DEET) on its real estate assets. Local Public Education Establishments (EPLE) are particularly targeted because they alone represent a very large part of this heritage. These objectives for 2030, 2040 and 2050 involve actions to reduce regular, significant and long-term energy consumption. The operation and maintenance of sites thus represents a significant and obligatory lever of action. for their achievement. The main purpose of this intellectual service framework agreement is: -The carrying out of Project Management Assistance (AMO) missions to support the Pays de la Loire Region in defining the need, the development, award, execution and monitoring of performance operation and maintenance contracts for technical equipment (heating, domestic hot water, ventilation) of public high schools in the Region. Furthermore, this framework agreement intellectual services has the secondary object: -The provision of services associated with the achievement of the main object of the contract. The associated services may concern study and expertise missions, performance monitoring, supervision of works, training and all other services linked to the smooth running of the operation and maintenance of sites and the improvement of installations..... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-02-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: RTE - TRANSPORT ELECTRICITY NETWORK. Summary: Broker to Support the Sale of an Rte Battery Energy Storage System. Description: In a context of the emergence of stationary storage systems, RTE (manager of the Electricity Transmission Network in France) launched a project in 2016 aimed at experimenting with the use of several storage sites (Electricity Storage System by Battery or Battery Energy Storage System - BESS). In particular, the so-called RINGO project aimed to test and qualify the use of this type of battery to manage local congestion on the HTB1 network, via demonstrators. experimental directly connected to the French General Transport Network. It was decided that the project would be deployed on three sites, which were selected because of their short-term exposure to transit constraints, constraints linked to the rapid installation of wind or photovoltaic production on the MV network in particular. Each selected site thus includes: •Batteries with a total power of 10 to 12 MW and an energy storage capacity of 24 to 33 MWh; •Of the control, command and communication equipment, in particular with the RTE IS application chain allowing battery management; •Power electronics equipment and equipment allowing voltage transformation between the batteries and the general network. Below is general technical information on each of the three sites Site -- Commissioning Date -- Useful power / energy (measured in December 2024) -- Voltage level.... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-02-06. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOWN OF LONGJUMEAU. Summary: Preventive and Curative Maintenance Services for Fire-Fighting Equipment. Description: This consultation concerns the preventive and curative maintenance contract for fire-fighting systems not controlled and controlled by electrical energy with which buildings belonging to or made available to the municipality of Longjumeau (including regular maintenance and repair); this in accordance with the regulations in force. Preventive and/or curative maintenance of installations will focus on the operating condition of the equipment and the safety of users. This maintenance includes: - Preventive maintenance with scheduled regulatory periodic site visits. It is intended to observe, inspect and analyze the actual state of existing technical installations in order to preserve their reference state. Also including the cleaning of equipment as well as the supply and change of usual parts called "planned work" - Curative maintenance with intervention for unforeseen or urgent repair work and for repair work replacement of equipment. It is intended to restore the reference state after observing a malfunction in existing installations, in the event of a breakdown of the installations between regulatory visits. The market went to mixed price and split in two parts: - a part with fixed prices fixed at the Breakdown of the Global and Fixed Price (DPGF) corresponding to preventive maintenance. - a part at unit prices set in the Unit Price Schedule.... To illustrate and make understandable to as many people as possible its role, its missions and its interactions with its partners, the HDH has implemented an events strategy, made up of national and international events, free or paid, open to very broad audiences, researchers, academics, students, start-ups, institutional, general public, press, industrial taking various forms such as national/international conferences, webinars... input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOWN OF LONGJUMEAU. Summary: Preventive and Curative Maintenance Services for Fire-Fighting Equipment. Description: This consultation concerns the preventive and curative maintenance contract for fire-fighting systems not controlled and controlled by electrical energy with which buildings belonging to or made available to the municipality of Longjumeau (including regular maintenance and repair); this in accordance with the regulations in force. Preventive and/or curative maintenance of installations will focus on the operating condition of the equipment and the safety of users. This maintenance includes: - Preventive maintenance with scheduled regulatory periodic site visits. It is intended to observe, inspect and analyze the actual state of existing technical installations in order to preserve their reference state. Also including the cleaning of equipment as well as the supply and change of usual parts known as "planned work" - Curative maintenance with intervention for unforeseen or urgent repair work and for repair work. replacement of equipment. It is intended to restore the reference state after observing a malfunction in existing installations, in the event of a breakdown of the installations between regulatory visits. The market is passed at a mixed price and split into two parts: - a part with fixed prices set at the Breakdown of the Global and Fixed Price (DPGF) corresponding to preventive maintenance. - a part at unit prices set in the Unit Price Schedule (B.... Description: The contract includes preventive maintenance services and curative maintenance services. Preventive maintenance involves: - a maintenance visit (cleaning, lubrication, adjustments of mechanical components) necessary for proper operation under normal safety conditions, - a check of the state of the effectiveness of the elements linked to proper operation and safety, - the supply of lubricating and cleaning products necessary for proper operation, - the establishment of a visit report. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOWN OF SANARY SUR MER (83). Summary: Notice of Call for Expression of Interest Prior to the Award of Authorization Agreements for Temporary Occupancy of the Public Domain Sanary Sur Mer Nautical Base. Description: The purpose of this call for expressions of interest is to select structures capable of developing, within the municipal nautical base of Sanary-sur-Mer, non-motorized nautical activities, supervised or not, as well as activities and activities. development of the site, compatible with: - the public vocation of the equipment, - its operation under municipal management, - the imperatives of security, environmental protection and sharing of uses. This approach is part of the policy sporting, educational, social and tourist activities of the Municipality, and aims in particular to: -promote access for the greatest number of people to the practice of nautical activities; -support the local associative fabric and initiatives of general interest; - promote sports nautical as vectors of awareness of the marine environment; - supervise the development of activities compatible with the public interest and the organization of the site. The proposed activities must be consistent with municipal guidelines. and where applicable the dynamics supported by the relevant sports federations. Within the framework of this notice for expression of interest, two categories of occupation are distinguished: - for use of non-profit general interest: sporting activities disinterested associations - for economic use: activities involving economic exploitation. Published Date: 2025-12-20. Closing Date: 2026-02-16. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SAINTE GENEVIÈVE DES BOIS TOWN HALL. Summary: Public Service Concession Relating to the Construction, Operation and Financing of a Crematorium in Sainte-Genevieve-Des-Bois. Description: Aware of the evolution of practices in the funeral field, the increase in the use of cremation in the years to come, and in order to improve its offer of funeral services, the Municipality of Sainte-Geneviève des Bois has considered the construction of a crematorium on its territory. A feasibility study, carried out in August 2025, confirmed the opportunity to build a crematorium on the territory of the Community due to the existing potential in terms of attendance, but also for make it possible to reduce cremation times in the north of the Essonne department. Given the specific nature of the management of such equipment, the use of a delegated management method such as public service delegation in the form of a concession service appeared to be the most relevant contractual arrangement for the realization of this project.. Published Date: 2025-12-19. Closing Date: 2026-03-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: SAINTE GENEVIÈVE DES BOIS TOWN HALL
output.Summary: Public Service Concession Relating to the Construction, Operation and Financing of a Crematorium in Sainte-Genevieve-Des-Bois
output.Description: Aware of the evolution of practices in the funeral field, the increase in the use of cremation in the years to come, and in order to improve its offer of funeral services, the Municipality of Sainte-Geneviève des Bois has considered the construction of a crematorium on its territory. A feasibility study, carried out in August 2025, confirmed the opportunity to build a crematorium on the territory of the Community due to the existing potential in terms of attendance, but also for make it possible to reduce cremation times in the north of the Essonne department. Given the specific nature of the management of such equipment, the use of a delegated management method such as public service delegation in the form of a concession service appeared to be the most relevant contractual arrangement for the realization of this project.

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PUBLIC OFFICE HABITAT COM AGGLO LA ROCHELLE. Summary: Carrying out a Three-Year Satisfaction Survey - Perception of the Quality of the Service Provided in Social Housing in New Aquitaine. Description: In 2003, the Hlm Movement embarked on a dynamic of measuring service quality through a three-year satisfaction survey system. The initial objective was to assess the level of tenant satisfaction with the service provided by the lessor (perceived quality). This commitment from the professional sector has led to a very strong mobilization of organizations for almost 20 years. Over time, organizations have deployed this survey, in addition to other types of surveys more targeted or thematic, often integrated into their day-to-day management tools. Measuring tenant satisfaction with the service provided always represents an essential issue for organizations; this survey allows the identification of major trends and sharing between organizations, and remains the basis for important actions, individual or collective, sometimes carried out inter-donor. Carrying out a three-year satisfaction survey - Perception of the quality of the service provided in social housing in New Aquitaine New Aquitaine organizations wish, through this common approach, to deepen their shared knowledge of the evolution of tenants' perceptions, share progress and difficulties, pool their efforts, and jointly display their results and their commitment to quality Doc Title: Carrying out a three-year satisfaction survey - Perception of the quality of the service provided in.... Summary: Public Service Delegation for the Award of Sub-Contracts for the Operation of Beach Lots 1 and 2 Located in the Territory of the Commune of Villeneuve - Les- Maguelone. Description: The concession for natural beaches in the commune of Villeneuve-lès-Maguelone granted to Montpellier Méditerranée Métropole by prefectural decree extends over a period of 10 years (period 2019-2029), with occupation of the Public Maritime Domain included between March and October, but limited to 6 months per year. The annual occupancy period of 6 months, including assembly, operation and dismantling, may be set each year by a metropolitan decree. By default, the operating period (assembly and dismantling) is set from April 1 to September 30. The metropolis plans to subcontract two batches of beaches, for a period ranging from notification of the contract until December 31, 2029: Lot 1: Prévost Beach - Equipment rental with catering Batch 2: Prévost Beach - Equipment rental with motorized watercraft A restaurant is also located set back from the dune barrier in the parking lot outside the Public Maritime Domain (DPM). Given the configuration of the premises, this space located in the parking lot adjoining is intended to be the subject of a temporary occupation authorization related to the operation of the beach lot, and will be allocated to the same operator as that of lot 1 Beach lot n°1 located on Prévost beach welcomes as its main activity rental of beach equipment and, as an ancillary activity, catering. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: METROPOLIS OF LYON. Summary: Transport and Handling of Works of Art and Heritage Collections for the Lugdunum Museum. Description: Lugdunum Museum and Roman Theaters, equipment directly managed by the Metropolis of Lyon, located 17 rue Cléberg - 69005 Lyon, is an archaeological museum whose collections are very diverse (ceramics, glass, stone, metal, mosaics, tablets, coatings painted, jewelry, stabilized organic materials such as archaeological wood, etc.). The collections can range from small archaeological furniture through statuary or elements of ancient architecture to funerary art, whether modest or more monumental. The museum also organizes temporary exhibitions which often require moving collections, handling, installation of works (assembly and dismantling of temporary exhibitions), transport, handling load of very voluminous objects not only from the museum's collections but also belonging to other French and foreign institutions known as lenders. The services requested and described in the specifications are aimed at transport works and archaeological objects in France or abroad (with customs formalities), the logistical organization of loans between museums, conveying, packaging, manufacturing of crates, handling of fragile or heavy works, installation, necessary for temporary exhibitions or for all needs of the collections management service of the Lugdunum Museum Transport and handling of works of art and heritage collections for.... input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CITY OF VILLEURBANNE. Summary: Grouping of Orders Relating to the Maintenance of Fire Extinguishers, Armed Fire Taps and Dry Columns on Property. Description: This consultation concerns the relaunch of the market relating to maintenance services for fire extinguishers, fire cocks and dry columns on the heritage of the city of Villeurbanne and the CCAS. It is more precisely the regulatory preventive maintenance, corrective maintenance, supply and installation of new equipment as part of the renewal of the fleet (ten years) or its extension. This is an order group taken in application of the agreement constitutive framework of a permanent grouping of orders between the CCAS and the City of Villeurbanne relating to the award of public contracts. The technical value criterion of the offer will be evaluated on the basis of the following sub-criteria: - Quality of the organization /30 - Quality of monitoring tools /10 - Quality of preventive maintenance reports /10. Published Date: 2025-12-18. Closing Date: 2026-01-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Grouping of Orders Relating to the Maintenance of Fire Extinguishers, Armed Fire Taps and Dry Columns on Property

It is more precisely the regulatory preventive maintenance, corrective maintenance, supply and installation of new equipment as part of the renewal of the fleet (ten years) or its extension. This is an order group taken in application of the agreement constitutive framework of a permanent grouping of orders between the CCAS and the City of Villeurbanne relating to the award of public contracts. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOWN OF LEVALLOIS. Summary: Supply and Delivery of Lunch Packages for Nursery Staff Members. Description: The purpose of this contract is the delivery of previously ordered lunch packages for members of the staff of Levallois crèches. Currently, 17 early childhood establishments are spread throughout the City. THE This contract is subject to the Public Order Code. This document is referred to as the Code. It is subject to the provisions of the CCAG Current Supplies and Services approved by Order of March 30, 2021. It is passed according to the procedure of adapted procedure contract opened in application of article R.2123-1 3° of the Code, its object constituting specific services, within the meaning of the notice of March 27, 2016 relating to public procurement contracts having as their object social and other services specific services. It is qualified as a service contract and constitutes a framework agreement with purchase orders subject to the provisions of articles L.2125-1 and R.2162-1 to R.2162-6 of the Code. This contract will be awarded to a single holder for a maximum duration of four years, renewals included. As this is an open procedure, the maximum number of participants is not limited. The total value of the contract is 800,000 euro(s) excluding tax, taking into account its maximum duration and possible renewals, i.e. 200,000 euro(s) excluding tax per year, with no minimum amount. Published Date: 2025-12-18. Closing Date: 2026-01-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Supply and Delivery of Lunch Packages for Nursery Staff Members
output.Description: The purpose of this contract is the delivery of previously ordered lunch packages for members of the staff of Levallois crèches. Description: The award procedure used is an open call for tenders, subject to the provisions of articles L. 2124-2, R. 2124-2 1° and R. 2161-2 to R. 2161-5 of the Public Procurement Code. The framework agreement with maximum is concluded in application of articles L2125-1 1°, R. 2162-1 to R. 2162-6 to 2162-14 of the Public Procurement Code. It will result in the issuance of purchase orders and the conclusion of subsequent contracts. Summary: Conservation and Restoration Services for the Collections of the Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art (Mamc) of Saint Etienne Métropole. Each object and each need being unique, all intervention objectives will be detailed in the specifications associated with the corresponding subsequent contracts, depending on the particularities thereof. The framework agreement, with a maximum per lot, will be executed by the conclusion of subsequent contracts. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: EDF TRADING LOGISTICS. Summary: Services Provided by Terminal Safety Officer in the French West Indies. Description: EDF TL ensures logistical operations linked to the supply of fuels and/or liquid biomass for the electricity production plants of EDF PEI and EDF located in Martinique, Saint-Barthélemy, Saint-Martin and Guadeloupe. In order to guarantee the smooth running and safety of operations, EDF TL uses Terminal Safety Officer services for monitoring and assistance during unloading of ships carrying hydrocarbons and/or biomass liquid. Provision of TERMINAL SAFETY OFFICER services in the French West Indies. In order to guarantee the smooth running and safety of operations, EDF TL uses Terminal Safety Officer services for monitoring and assistance during unloading from ships carrying hydrocarbons and/or liquid biomass. The Terminal Safety Officer is an expert in petroleum and maritime operations. Its mission consists of supervising operations throughout the duration of unloading, ensuring the prevention of risks, the protection of people, installations and the environment, as well as compliance with established rules and good professional practices. The services take place in Martinique, Guadeloupe, Saint Barthélémy and Saint Martin. Doc Title: Services provided by TERMINAL SAFETY OFFICER in the French West Indies Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-12-18. Closing Date: 2026-01-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PARIS AIRPORTS. Summary: Operation of the Valet and Valet Activity for Passengers at Paris-Charles De Gaulle Airport.. Description: The purpose of this consultation is the award of contracts allowing the exercise by the successful holder of the valet and valet activity, the handling, conveying, parking and return of passenger vehicles, by staff dedicated in specific public reception and operating areas of Paris-Charles de Gaulle airport. Operation of the valet and valet activity for passengers at Paris-Charles de Gaulle airport. Supporting Contracts the activity are granted for a period of 7 years, renewable three times per period of one year, will have an effective date of October 1, 2026 and the latest expiry date of October 1, 2036. The purpose of these Contracts is to describe the terms and conditions according to which the areas necessary for the activity are made available to the successful holder and operated by him at Paris - Charles de Gaulle airport. These contracts set out in particular the terms under which the successful holder pays Aéroports de Paris rents and is remunerated by marketing services to customers. In addition, these Contracts specify the conditions of membership of the future holder as (i) Seller on the Extime Marketplace, (ii) Partner of the Extime Rewards loyalty program and, (iii) Non-exclusive licensed user of the “Extime” brand. Doc Title: Operation of the valet and valet activity for passengers on the airline.... Published Date: 2025-12-18. Closing Date: 2026-01-13. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: THE POST OFFICE. Summary: Supply and Integration of a Data Extraction, Transformation and Loading Solution and Associated Services. Description: The IT Services Department (i-TEAM Department) of La Poste wishes to acquire a software solution for extracting, transforming and loading data in SaaS or Hybrid mode and associated services. The solution will be sent to La Poste and will cover firm services on the deployment of the solution and optional services, detailed below. The language of the proposed solution and services (support, training, etc.) must be in French. The exchanges are will be exclusively in French. The application must comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). The processing of personal data of La Poste, including hosting, storage and/or consultation must must be located within the European Union (EU), a country in the European Economic Area (EEA), or a country recognized as suitable by the European Union. The solution must comply with digital accessibility obligations, and responsible design of digital services in accordance with the RGAA (General Framework for Improvement of Accessibility). The solution must also comply with the La Poste Group (PSSIG) security policy. The consultation file that will be sent to the selected service providers will specify the elements linked to this requirement. The consultation consists of a single lot. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PROVENCE-ALPES-CÔTE D-AZUR REGION. Summary: Public Service Delegation for the Management and Operation of Avignon Airport 2027-2036. Description: This consultation is organized within the framework of the provisions of the public procurement code as well as articles L.1411-1 et seq. and R.1411-1 of the General Code of Local Authorities. Candidates are therefore alerted to the fact that they must submit their application and their offer at the same time. The purpose of the public service delegation will be to entrust by leasing the operation, upkeep and maintenance of the airport, its land, structures, buildings, infrastructure, equipment, networks and services as well as the management and development of the airport public domain. Avignon-Provence airport, owned by the Provence Alpes Côte d'Azur Region since 2007, combines several assets for the benefit of the Vaucluse region and regional: an airport platform focused on business and leisure aviation which also operates essential civil security and emergency medical transport missions; a public airport domain welcoming more than 50 companies and 500 jobs. In order to consolidate these assets, the delegatee will have to develop and promote the airport following a strategy focused on business aviation and the continuation of the dynamic of economic development on the land of the platform by targeting activities with high added value and job creation. Its strategy will also include an ambitious environmental trajectory across the entire airport, strengthening its territorial roots while.... Published Date: 2025-12-18. Closing Date: 2026-02-01. Description: The purpose of this contract is the delivery of previously ordered lunch packages for members of the staff of Levallois crèches. It is subject to the provisions of the CCAG Current Supplies and Services approved by Order of March 30, 2021. It is passed according to the procedure of adapted procedure contract opened in application of article R.2123-1 3° of the Code, its object constituting specific services, within the meaning of the notice of March 27, 2016 relating to public procurement contracts having as their object social and other services specific services. It is qualified as a service contract and constitutes a framework agreement with purchase orders subject to the provisions of articles L.2125-1 and R.2162-1 to R.2162-6 of the Code. This contract will be awarded to a single holder for a maximum duration of four years, renewals included. As this is an open procedure, the maximum number of participants is not limited. The total value of the contract is 800,000 euro(s) excluding tax, taking into account its maximum duration and possible renewals, i.e. 200,000 euro(s) excluding tax per year, with no minimum amount SUPPLY AND DELIVERY OF LUNCH PACKAGES FOR NURSERY STAFF MEMBERS The purpose of this contract is the delivery of pre-prepared lunch packages.... input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PAYS DE LA LOIRE REGION. Description: Framework agreement for project management assistance for the preparation, award and monitoring of Operations-Performance Maintenance and Associated Services Contracts (MEMPSA) for the needs of EPs... The Pays de la Loire Region wishes to register fully in achieving the objectives of the Tertiary Eco Energy System (DEET) on its real estate assets. Local Public Education Establishments (EPLE) are particularly targeted because they alone represent a very large part of this heritage. These objectives for 2030, 2040 and 2050 involve actions to reduce regular, significant and long-term energy consumption. The operation and maintenance of sites thus represents a significant and obligatory lever of action. for their achievement. The main purpose of this intellectual service framework agreement is: -The carrying out of Project Management Assistance (AMO) missions to support the Pays de la Loire Region in defining the need, the development, award, execution and monitoring of high-performance operation and maintenance contracts for technical equipment (heating, domestic hot water, ventilation) of public high schools in the Region. Furthermore, this framework agreement intellectual services has the secondary purpose of: -The provision of services associated with the achievement of the main purpose of the contract. The associated services may concern study and expertise missions, performance monitoring, supervision of works, training and all other services linked to the smooth running of the operation and maintenance of sites and the improvement of installations..... Description: The purpose of this contract is the renovation of the control command (CC) and general electrical installations (IEG) of the PontenRoyans development. The main goal is to compensate for its obsolescence in order to maintain the performance and availability of groups. This operation will provide efficient layout and optimized driving. Renovation of control, command (CC) and general electrical installations (IEG) of the PONT EN ROYANS factory (38) The main works, services services and supplies provided for in this renovation contract are listed below: - Zero point: the renovation of the IEG and CC requires creating a zero point during the fall arrest prior to the work (2027) or in the year preceding the work (2026 date to be confirmed); - HV substation and transformers: integration of new RPN T1, T2, T3+T4 (with consolidation boxes) as well as their respective instrumentation: CT, VT, circuit breaker, disconnector, etc. (the coupling of T4 will be modified to go from 230Vac three-phase) - Factory work, groups, general services: removal of non-renewed equipment and conservation of reused equipment, removal and replacement of asbestos-containing pathway slabs in the basement (SS3), supply of installation and connections of the TGBT, replacement of the 127Vcc energy workshop then addition of 127Vcc/24Vcc converters in the DC, modification of the industrial air supply, modification of the drainage supply, modification of the prices.... input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: THE POST OFFICE. Summary: Supply and Integration of a Data Extraction, Transformation and Loading Solution and Associated Services. Description: The IT Services Department (i-TEAM Department) of La Poste wishes to acquire a software solution for extracting, transforming and loading data in SaaS or Hybrid mode and associated services. The solution will be sent to La Poste and will cover firm services on the deployment of the solution and optional services, detailed below. The language of the proposed solution and services (support, training, etc.) must be in French. The exchanges are will be exclusively in French. The application must comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). The processing of personal data of La Poste, including hosting, storage and/or consultation must must be located within the European Union (EU), a country in the European Economic Area (EEA), or a country recognized as suitable by the European Union. The solution must comply with digital accessibility obligations, and responsible design of digital services in accordance with the RGAA (General Framework for Improvement of Accessibility). The solution must also comply with the La Poste Group (PSSIG) security policy. The consultation file that will be sent to the selected service providers will specify the elements linked to this requirement. The consultation consists of a single lot. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SOLIDEO ALPES 2030. Summary: Mission of Land Assistance and Legal Representation for Land Control of the Areas Necessary for the Construction of the Olympic Works. Description: The purpose of the framework agreement is to carry out land assistance and legal representation missions for land control of the areas necessary for the construction of the Olympic works with Solideo Alpes 2030. The consultation initiated aims to conclude a single-awarder framework agreement, as regulated by articles R. 2162-2 to R.2162-14 of the Public Procurement Code, on the basis of which purchase orders will be issued and subsequent contracts concluded. This framework agreement is concluded without a minimum amount and with a maximum annual amount in accordance with article R. 2162-4 2° of the Public Procurement Code. The maximum annual amount in euros excluding tax is set at 3,000,000 euro(s) excluding tax. Main place of performance: the services are executed mainly on the poles identified in the paragraph "scope and strategy of land action" of the CCTP, namely the Briançonnais pole, the Haute-Savoie pole and the Savoie pole. The holder may, however, also intervene on other sites placed under project management or supervision of Solideo Alpes 2030. Le contexte de l'accord-cadre, ainsi que le détail des missions, sont précisés dans le Cahier des Clauses Techniques Particulières de l'accord cadre (CCTP-AC) et its annexes. The estimate covers the total duration of the contract, all options (within the meaning of European law) included. Mission of land assistance and legal representation for land control of em.... input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: METROPOLE NICE CÔTE D'AZUR. Summary: Public Service Concession Relating to the Rehabilitation and Operating of the Port of Beaulieu Ants. Description: The purpose of this consultation is the award by the Nice Côte d'Azur Metropolis of a public service concession contract. The purpose of the contract will be to entrust the concessionaire with the execution and financing of the port rehabilitation works. of Beaulieu Fourmis according to the program which will be given to candidates admitted to continue the procedure, operation, maintenance and management of the public port service of the port, at their own risk. PUBLIC SERVICE CONCESSION RELATING TO THE REHABILITATION AND OPERATING OF THE PORT OF BEAULIEU ANTS The concessionaire is responsible for operating and maintaining the port of Beaulieu Fourmis, at its own risk. He recruits and manages staff. The concessionaire must also design, carry out and finance port redevelopment work. The services expected from the future concessionaire will be specified in the “offer phase” consultation documents which will be sent only to candidates admitted to continue the procedure. The overall cost of the investment for the realization of the project was estimated at approximately 1.7 million euros (constant euros). Doc Title: PUBLIC SERVICE CONCESSION RELATING TO THE REHABILITATION AND OPERATION OF THE PORT OF BEAULIEU ANTS Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-12-17. Closing Date: 2026-01-29. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SIEL LOIRE ENERGY TERRITORY. Summary: Advisory, Assistance and Expertise Missions for the Monitoring and Control of the Thd42® Leasing Contract. Description: The contract covers the following services: Advisory, assistance and expertise missions for the monitoring and control of the THD42® leasing contract in the Loire department Within the framework of national development guidelines from the very highest speed, SIEL-TE has decided to create an optical fiber network to ensure very high speed service to all the municipalities of the Loire department outside the AMII zones (Call for Expression of Investment Intention). The 320 communes of the Loire department are distributed as follows: - 49 municipalities, located within the perimeters of Saint-Étienne Métropole and Roannais Agglomération, are in the Orange AMII zone, (list of AMII municipalities in appendix) - 271 municipalities, falling within of 11 public intercommunal cooperation establishments (including 1 Rhone EPCI), are the subject of the T.H.D.42® program SIEL-TE Loire and the local communities and agglomerations of the territory launched the THD42 program in 2015. This program has was financially supported by the State, the Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes Region and European FEDER funds. The THD42 program is a public service delegation (DSP) in leasing for a period of 15 years. The contract was notified to the LOTIM / AXIONE / group BOUYGUES ENERGIES SERVICES on November 14, 2014. The main services to be carried out are: -The supply of adhesive films (including the numbering of trains, technical signage, logos and roundels for MF01 equipment), -Depositing films on the exterior walls of equipment cars, -Corrosion treatment for MF01 equipment, -Repainting for MF01 equipment, -The installation of films on the exterior walls of equipment cars (including the installation of the numbering of trains, technical signage, logos and roundels). It is specified that the definition of the logos, the numbering of the trains and the technical signage will be provided by the RATP so that the holder has them printed for the material MF01. The exterior trim changes concern 172 MF01s (46 MF01 L2, 52 MF01 L5 and 75 MF01 L9). These livery changes are put into 3 Lots. This consultation therefore comprises three lots: -LOT 1: MF01 livery of line 2 - 46 oars -LOT 2: MF01 livery of line 5 - 52 trainsets -LOT 3: MF01 livery of line 9 - 75 trainsets Lot 1 - EVOLUTION OF THE MF01 LIVERY IN IDFM COLORS Line 2 Service for replacement of exterior cladding.... input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: DEPARTMENT OF VAR. Summary: Provision of Magazine Printing Service for the Var Department. Description: The Department of Var publishes various publications to present its missions, inform the people of Var and promote the wealth of the territory. It mainly produces three types of magazines: - Le Var magazine: annual publication, generally published in June (before summer). - The magazine Le Var et Vous: quarterly publication. - Special editions: publications published on average twice a year, depending on current events. The contract is awarded for a period of one year (or 12 months), from the date of notification. It is renewable 3 times per period of one year, by express renewal, the total duration of the contract cannot exceed 4 years. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PREMERY TOWN HALL. Summary: Delegation of the Public Service for Production and Distribution of Drinking Water. Description: The management of the delegated service includes the operation, including in particular the maintenance and monitoring of drinking water production and distribution installations (works, networks and network accessories, connections and meters); water supply for subscribers, the monitoring and control of the quality of water produced and distributed, the search for anomalies likely to disrupt the proper functioning of the service and the resolution of these situations within the limits defined by the contract; there carrying out the work charged to the Delegate by the contract; managing relations with subscribers of the public drinking water distribution service; information and technical assistance to the Community to enable it to control the service, in particular by the transmission of precise and reliable data. Technical characteristics of the service (2024 data): number of subscribers: 1,257; volumes billed to subscribers: 99,033 m3; volumes produced: 150,459 m3; yield: 78.25%; ILVNC: 2.91 m3/km/d; resources: Vauclan well and Villier well; production station: Les Battants ultrafiltration station; length of networks: 40.79 km; 2 tanks.
