Description: This framework agreement is entered into in the form of a single-award framework agreement, without minimum and with a maximum, according to articles R.2162-1 to R.2162-6 and R.2162-13 and R.2162-14 of the Public Procurement Code. The maximum amount of benefits for any the duration of the framework agreement is 3,000,000 euro(s) excluding tax for lot 1 and 3,000,000 euro(s) excluding tax for lot 2. Each framework agreement will be allocated to a single economic operator. The framework agreement includes systematic benefits and services punctual. Systematic services: These are services to be provided to residences at an indicated periodicity and remunerated within the framework of the Breakdown of the Global and Fixed Price (D.P.G.F.). One-off services: Part of the framework agreement will be processed by purchase orders issued by Toulouse Métropole HABITAT, under the conditions set out in articles R.2162-13 and R.2162-14 of the Public Procurement Code. These are the services, subject of this framework agreement, to be provided each time that Toulouse Métropole Habitat will issue a voucher according to the unit prices of the framework agreement indicated in the Unit Price Schedule (B.P.U.) input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: RATP. Summary: Reception Service and Management of Orientation and Sales Support Flows for Ratp Network Spaces. Description: The purpose of this notice is to provide reception services and guidance and sales support flows for the RATP network spaces. The services consist of ensuring a diversity of missions, both complementary and adapted to the needs of the field, each contributing to advising, informing, guiding, making travel more fluid, regulating the different modes of transport, or even supporting travelers in the purchase of transport tickets. These missions include: • Management of passenger flows, aimed at optimizing comfort and guaranteeing safety in busy areas; •Reception, information and orientation, making it possible to deliver personalized or repetitive information, and to guide travelers towards the good routes or directions; •Support for rail regulation, consisting of facilitating the rapid exit of passengers from trains, in accordance with the operator's strict instructions; •Assistance in bus regulation, including support for load of passengers, checking the absence of passengers at the end of the journey, •Reporting on accessible lines (A and B) of the presence of a Wheelchair User (UFR) requiring the intervention of an RATP agent; •Support in the choice and purchase of the transport ticket, which can go as far as the direct sale of the ticket through mobility sales. Description: The purpose of this consultation is to coordinate chlorine-free and micropollutant water groups. In order to share the problems encountered in the implementation of the innovative sector insertion project high-performance membrane filtration, SEDIF initiated the chlorine-free water group in 2020 then the micropollutants group in mid-2023: ? the chlorine-free water group is a tool available to SEDIF but also to communities wishing to use it invest and affected by this issue. The objective is to better control the developments necessary to achieve the distribution of water with little or no chlorination. This group is currently made up of around twenty members: scientists specialists in the microbiological quality of water and pipe materials, French and European project owners already using chlorine-free water or wishing to achieve it and French institutions. This group meets at least twice per year. ? the micropollutants group is made up of around thirty public stakeholders in water, sanitation and aquatic environments, the discussions of this working group will focus on metrology, prevention actions, treatments, toxicological studies on environments, organisms and human health with the objective of sharing knowledge and experiences. This group meets at least twice a year.. Published Date: 2025-12-15. Closing Date: 2026-01-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SAEML CYCLEA. Summary: Guarding and Private Security Services. Description: The purpose of this contract is the execution of physical guarding services provided by security and prevention agents on the sites operated by SAEML CYCLEA. The missions entrusted include in particular: - Fixed guards (posts of static monitoring); - Internal and external security rounds; - Resolving doubts following an alarm triggering, with an intervention time of less than 30 minutes - Interventions in the event of an incident, in strict compliance with the legal prerogatives applicable to private security agents; - Assistance and first aid actions (SST) as well as fire safety and evacuation missions (SSIAP). CYCLEA wishes to retain a maximum of two service providers (subject to the sufficient number of offers). The Specifications of Special Technical Clauses (CCTP) defines the conditions for carrying out the aforementioned services. The contract is awarded in accordance with the provisions of the Public Procurement Code. Published Date: 2025-12-15. Closing Date: 2026-01-06. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOWN OF SARREGUEMINES. Summary: Global Public Energy Performance Contract Relating to the Rental with Option to Purchase and the Operation and Maintenance of Public Lighting Equipment. Description: The City of Sarreguemines has decided to undertake an energy renovation operation for its existing public lighting fleet. In this context, the City is considering the conclusion of a Global Performance Market aimed at the installation of equipment high-quality public lighting, integrating a remote management device for each light point. This approach is based on the use of innovative technologies to ensure: - increased energy sobriety, - a notable reduction in the costs of operation (management, maintenance, operation), - and an overall improvement in the technical performance of the installations. The offers presented by the candidates must guarantee an optimal balance between energy sobriety, security and attractiveness. urban, while integrating the communication and consultation aspects necessary to inform the City and its citizens. This orientation is broken down into four priority areas: - Reduction of light pollution and preservation of biodiversity, - Optimization of electrical energy consumption, meeting a dual ecological and economic objective, - Deployment of advanced technologies (LED lighting, remote management systems), - Improvement of technical performances, including the renovation of assets, limiting the risks of breakdowns or disasters, and improving the living environment. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PAYS DE LA LOIRE REGION. Summary: Tariff Integration Surveys in Urban Perimeters. Description: In order to develop intermodality practices in collective passenger transport, the Pays de la Loire Region, in partnership with the urban mobility organizing authorities, has implemented fare integration agreements. These Fare systems currently allow access to regional trains within the territorial jurisdiction with urban tickets for journeys made entirely within this territorial jurisdiction. The purpose of this framework agreement is to carrying out measurements to know the proportion of travelers concerned, analyzing reliable and consolidated data, as well as calculating tariff compensation for each urban area. The incumbent will also be responsible for the presentation of all the results to the Region and its partners. TARIFF INTEGRATION SURVEYS IN URBAN PERIMETERS This framework agreement is mixed (article R2162-3 of the public procurement code); it can therefore be executed by means of purchase orders on the based on the prices indicated in the unit price schedule but also through subsequent contracts. This framework agreement is single-awarded. The minimum and maximum cumulative amounts of orders and subsequent contracts that can be carried out in the framework of this framework agreement are defined as follows: - minimum amount: €20,000 excluding VAT for 12 months - maximum amount: €250,000 excluding VAT for 12 months. Doc Title: TARIFF INTEGRATION SURVEYS IN URBAN PERIMETERS.... Published Date: 2025-12-15. Closing Date: 2026-01-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PARIS HABITAT - OPH. Summary: Shared Parking Marketing Service for Vacant Parking Spaces Located in Paris Habitat Car Parks (4 Lots). Description: In accordance with the provisions of articles L411-4 and L411-5 of the CCH, DPOs can freely rent on a precarious basis the vacant parking areas they have. The granting authority, Paris Habitat, entrusts the concessionaire, who acts as as an intermediary, in particular the following missions: - Referencing the car parks concerned on an electronic platform - Installation, management and maintenance of electric charging infrastructure - Dissemination of parking offers and customer acquisition - Contracting and management of parking lots - User services, invoicing and collection from Concessionaire users. The launch of this consultation follows the declaration failure of lot 2 of procedure no. 2025-1116 (OJEU announcement no. 403315-2025 and online markets AO-2527-1020). Indeed, this previous procedure was declared unsuccessful by a decision of the tender commission dated 09/23/2025. THE services are divided into 4 lots. Each lot will result in the establishment of a separate concession contract. For each lot, the contract is concluded for a firm period of five years. THE The aim of the campaign is to increase the competitiveness of European corn in France and Spain with 3 major objectives: - Increase the French surface area cultivated with grain corn - Increase the share of grain corn of European origin purchased by Spanish processors and users - Increase awareness among the general French public of the positive externalities of corn in terms of sustainability and the different uses of this cereal Consultation mode: open call for tenders Deadline for answer: 01/09/2026 Contacts: Aloys Tack atack@intercereales.com Marie David mdavid@intercereales.com Tender documents to download here: https://www.intercereales.com/appel-doffres-programme-de-promotion-du-mais-europeen-en-france-et-en-espagne-2027-2029 EUROPEAN INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION PROGRAM FOR AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTS (MAIZE IN FRANCE AND SPAIN) - 2027 - 2029 Intercéales is launching a call for tenders for the submission of a subsidy application for a promotion program co-financed by the European Union, then the implementation of this program if the subsidy application is accepted by the Commission European. The purpose of this framework agreement is to carry out complete or partial project management services relating to the Works of Art, consisting of the carrying out of design studies (from the phase diagnosis/preliminary studies) then monitoring the work allowing the reinforcement and/or rehabilitation of existing structures or the creation of new structures: in accordance with the MOP law. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: GUADELOUPE REGION. Summary: Project Management Mandate Within the Meaning of the Provisions of Articles L2422-5 to L2422-11 of the Public Procurement Code for the Construction of the University Health Campus (Cus). Description: The Guadeloupe Region, in partnership with the State and the University of the Antilles, plans to build a University Health Campus (CUS) in Les Abymes, intended to respond to new university and research practices in the field of health. THE CUS, located next to the future CHU, will bring together in the same place many complementary players in the health field: practitioners, medical students, paramedical students, teachers, researchers, etc. The first phase of the campus will include: * a University of Training and Research (UFR) of medicine, * an Institute and School of Paramedical Training and * a simulation center, the use of which is shared between the two previous structures. The UFR and the simulation center are built for the on behalf of the State, via a project management transfer agreement between the region and the State. Thus the corresponding works will be the subject of a retrocession, from the region to the State, at the end of construction. A university restaurant and university residences, managed by the CROUS, are also planned within the campus. However, they are not part of the regional project management operation. In the longer term, in a 2nd phase, other facilities, such as a research center, a university health library, or even other equipment could be located on this campus (land reserve planned as part of the project). The regional community has def.... Published Date: 2025-12-15. Closing Date: 2026-01-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SEWING SAW (EPTB LIGHT). Summary: Environmental and Socio-Economic Study for the Definition of a Flood Hazard Management Strategy in the Lys Watershed. Description: This study brings together action sheets 1.01, 1.02, 6.01 and 6.02 of the PEP. Its objective is to prepare the hazard management aspect of the future PAPI 4. It will mainly consist of: - Take stock of the storage volume available in the basin slope of the Lys; -Determine the initial state of the environment; -Analyze certain projects currently being defined; -Provide proposals for Nature-Based Solutions (NFS) to help reduce the risk of flooding ; -Propose an optimization of the management method for structures in flood; -Carry out the multi-criteria analysis and environmental assessment of the developed program. Two principles should guide the service provider in carrying out the study: -Take into account the effects of the proposed developments both as a tool for reducing hazards on a local scale and as a large-scale tool for reducing contributions to the large-scale canal; -Comply with the spirit of the multi-criteria analysis approach and environmental assessment and as such have an iterative approach to its definition of projects. The action program studied by the office must be part of the adaptation strategy to climate change in the Lys basin. As such, the Proposals must be designed to respond to the challenges of the current climate as well as those of the prospects for climate change. hydrological development strategy for the Lys watershed It concerns the development of.... Published Date: 2025-12-15. Closing Date: 2026-02-02. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Services include: Cleaning of premises including pest control inside and around the building, pest control and disinfection of the sites concerned, Maintenance of green spaces by weeding or uprooting manual, clearing and pruning of trees, and finally the maintenance of fences. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: GUADELOUPE REGION. Summary: Project Management Mandate Within the Meaning of the Provisions of Articles L2422-5 to L2422-11 of the Public Procurement Code for the Construction of the University Health Campus (Cus). Description: The Guadeloupe Region, in partnership with the State and the University of the Antilles, plans to build a University Health Campus (CUS) in Les Abymes, intended to respond to new university and research practices in the field of health. THE CUS, located next to the future CHU, will bring together in the same place many complementary players in the field of health: practitioners, medical students, paramedical students, teachers, researchers, etc. The first phase of the campus will include: * a University of Training and Research (UFR) of medicine, * an Institute and School of Paramedical Training and * a simulation center, the use of which is shared between the two previous structures. The UFR and the simulation center are built for the on behalf of the State, via a project management transfer agreement between the region and the State. Thus the corresponding works will be the subject of a retrocession, from the region to the State, at the end of construction. A university restaurant and university residences, managed by the CROUS, are also planned within the campus. However, they are not part of the regional project management operation. In the longer term, in a 2nd phase, other facilities, such as a research center, a university health library, or even other equipment could be located on this campus (land reserve planned as part of the project). The regional community has defined the ph.... Published Date: 2025-12-15. Closing Date: 2026-01-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PAYS DE LA LOIRE REGION. Summary: Tariff Integration Surveys in Urban Perimeters. Description: In order to develop intermodality practices in collective passenger transport, the Pays de la Loire Region, in partnership with the urban mobility organizing authorities, has implemented fare integration agreements. These Fare systems currently allow access to regional trains within the territorial jurisdiction with urban tickets for journeys made entirely within this territorial jurisdiction. The purpose of this framework agreement is to carrying out measurements to know the proportion of travelers concerned, analyzing reliable and consolidated data, as well as calculating tariff compensation for each urban area. The incumbent will also be responsible for the presentation of all the results to the Region and its partners.. Published Date: 2025-12-15. Closing Date: 2026-01-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The buyer decides to use a framework agreement in accordance with articles R2162-1 to -6 of the Code of public order For each lot, this is a single-award framework agreement for services which will be executed by issuing purchase orders notified by the buyer as and when required. It may also give rise to the conclusion of contracts subsequent orders under the conditions of articles R2162-7 to 10 of the Code. For each lot, the contract is concluded from its notification date, for an initial period of 1 year. The contract can be renewed three times per successive period of 1 year, for a maximum total duration of 4 years. The renewal is tacit and therefore considered accepted if no written decision to the contrary is taken by the buyer. The holder cannot object. The total estimated value shown below corresponds to the estimate of the framework agreement on all the lots and their maximum duration (i.e. initial period and all renewals included).
